snippet: The National Transportation Safety Board issued a report on the crash on May 31 near Boston that killed seven people, including Lewis Katz, co-owner of The Philadelphia Inquirer.
abstract: National Transportation Safety Board issues report saying wreckage of executive jet that crashed on takeoff at airport near Boston on May 31 shows signs of mechanical malfunction; crash killed seven people, including Lewis Katz, co-owner of The Philadelphia Inquirer.
lead_paragraph: The National Transportation Safety Board issued a report on the crash on May 31 near Boston that killed seven people, including Lewis Katz, co-owner of The Philadelphia Inquirer.

headline.main: Malfunction Seen in Jet Crash That Killed Co-owner of Philadelphia Inquirer
headline.print_headline: Massachusetts: Malfunction Is Seen in Crash of Jet
